item.title: A Cisco device as a TFTP server
item.description: TFTP or Trivial File Transfer Protocol is a simple file transfer protocol. TFTP uses UDP port 69, no authentication or encryption is supported, and directory navigation is not possible. Three file transfer methods are available: netascii (or ASCII for text files), octet (or image for binary files), and mail (not used anymore).
